requiredDocuments: Complete W-2 form from all employers
resolutionSteps: Contact employer for a copy of W-2|Submit W-2 through IRS amendment process|If W-2 unavailable, complete Form 4852 (Substitute for W-2)
Contact payer for a copy of 1099|Submit 1099 through IRS amendment process|If 1099 unavailable, report income based on personal records

requiredDocuments: Government-issued photo ID|Social Security card or official document showing SSN|Proof of address (utility bill, bank statement)
resolutionSteps: Complete IRS Form 14039 (Identity Theft Affidavit)|Submit required identification documents|Call IRS Identity Verification Service at 1-800-830-5084
Review IRS correction notice|Verify calculations on your return|Submit Form 1040X if you disagree with IRS correction

requiredDocuments: Proof of relationship to dependent|Proof dependent lived with you (school records, medical records)|Social Security number verification
resolutionSteps: Determine who is eligible to claim dependent based on IRS rules|Submit documentation proving eligibility|If ineligible, file amended return without claiming dependent

requiredDocuments: Proof of income|Proof of relationship to qualifying children|Social Security cards for all claimed individuals
resolutionSteps: Complete Form 8862 (Information to Claim Earned Income Credit)|Submit documentation proving eligibility|If ineligible, file amended return without claiming EIC

requiredDocuments: Voided check or bank statement showing account information
resolutionSteps: Verify correct bank routing and account numbers|Submit Form 8888 with corrected banking information|Contact IRS at 1-800-829-1040 to update direct deposit information

requiredDocuments: Receipts for claimed deductions|Documentation supporting deduction eligibility|Explanation letter for unusual deductions
resolutionSteps: Gather all documentation supporting claimed deductions|Organize receipts and proof of payment by category|Submit documentation to IRS address provided in audit notice|If documentation unavailable, prepare explanation letter

requiredDocuments: Foreign tax returns filed|Form 1116 (Foreign Tax Credit)|Form 2555 (Foreign Earned Income)|Foreign account statements
resolutionSteps: Provide documentation of foreign income sources|Submit proof of foreign taxes paid|Complete FBAR if foreign accounts exceed $10,000|Submit Form 8938 if foreign assets exceed threshold

requiredDocuments: Business income and expense records|1099 forms received|Schedule C documentation|Business bank account statements
resolutionSteps: Provide detailed profit and loss statement|Submit documentation of business expenses claimed|Provide client payment records or invoices|If applicable, submit Form 4562 for depreciation

description: Issue with previous year's tax return affecting current return
requiredDocuments: Copy of previous year's tax return|Documentation resolving previous year's issues
resolutionSteps: Review IRS notice regarding previous year's return|Resolve outstanding issues from previous return|Submit amended return for previous year if necessary|Provide documentation showing resolution

requiredDocuments: Child's birth certificate|Social Security card for child|School or medical records showing child's residence|Proof of relationship
resolutionSteps: Verify child meets age requirements for Child Tax Credit|Submit documentation proving child lived with you|Provide proof of relationship to child|If ineligible, file amended return without claiming credit

requiredDocuments: Death certificate|Trust documents|Letters testamentary or letters of administration|Form 56 (Notice Concerning Fiduciary Relationship)
resolutionSteps: Submit certified copy of death certificate|Provide legal documentation establishing executor/trustee status|Submit complete trust documents if applicable|Complete Form 8971 if estate exceeds exclusion amount

requiredDocuments: Form 1095-A, 1095-B, or 1095-C|Proof of health insurance coverage|Documentation for coverage exemption claim
resolutionSteps: Submit health insurance marketplace statement|Provide proof of coverage for each month of tax year|If claiming exemption, submit Form 8965|If receiving premium tax credit, verify Form 8962

requiredDocuments: FEMA registration number|Insurance claim documentation|Proof of residence in declared disaster area|Documentation of losses
resolutionSteps: Verify residence in federally declared disaster area|Document losses not covered by insurance|Complete Form 4684 (Casualties and Thefts)|Provide photos or appraisals of damaged property
